class.name: RenderSceneData
class.brief_description: Abstract render data object, holds scene data related to rendering a single frame of a viewport.
class.description: Abstract scene data object, exists for the duration of rendering a single viewport. See also [RenderSceneDataRD], [RenderData], and [RenderDataRD]. [b]Note:[/b] This is an internal rendering server object. Do not instantiate this class from a script.

method.name: decal_atlas_get_texture
method.description: Returns the [RID] of the decal atlas texture.

method.name: decal_atlas_get_texture_srgb
method.description: Returns the [RID] of the decal atlas texture in sRGB.

method.name: directional_shadow_get_texture
method.description: Returns the [RID] of the directional shadow atlas texture.

method.name: get_cam_projection
method.description: Returns the camera projection used to render this frame. [b]Note:[/b] If more than one view is rendered, this will return a combined projection.

method.name: get_cam_transform
method.description: Returns the camera transform used to render this frame. [b]Note:[/b] If more than one view is rendered, this will return a centered transform.

method.name: get_directional_light_buffer
method.description: Returns the [RID] of the directional light buffer, which contains the scene directional light data for each light source as a UBO.

method.name: get_omni_light_buffer
method.description: Returns the [RID] of the omni light buffer, which contains the scene omni light data as a UBO.

method.name: get_spot_light_buffer
method.description: Returns the [RID] of the spot light buffer, which contains the scene spot light data as a UBO.

method.name: get_uniform_buffer
method.description: Return the [RID] of the uniform buffer containing the scene data as a UBO.

method.name: get_view_count
method.description: Returns the number of views being rendered.

method.name: get_view_eye_offset
method.description: Returns the eye offset per view used to render this frame. This is the offset between our camera transform and the eye transform.

method.name: get_view_projection
method.description: Returns the view projection per view used to render this frame. [b]Note:[/b] If a single view is rendered, this returns the camera projection. If more than one view is rendered, this will return a projection for the given view including the eye offset.
